channel.title: Tarid Wongvorachan
channel.description: Welcome to my data science blog!

item.title: Addressing Data Imbalance with Semi-Supervised Learning
item.dc:creator: Tarid Wongvorachan
item.description:
For this post, I will use semi-supervised learning approach to perform a classification task with a highly imbalance data.
(7 min read)

item.title: Examining Customer Cluster with Unsupervised Machine Learning
item.dc:creator: Tarid Wongvorachan
item.description:
In this post, I will be using two unsupervised learning techniques with a data set, namely K-means clustering and Hierarchical clustering, to determine groups of customers from their age, income, and spending behavior data.
(8 min read)

item.title: Combining Multiple Machine Learning Models with the Ensemble Methods
item.dc:creator: Tarid Wongvorachan
item.description:
This entry explores different ways to combine supervised machine learning models to maximize their predictive capability.
(13 min read)

item.title: Examining PISA 2018 Data Set with Statistical Learning Approach
item.dc:creator: Tarid Wongvorachan
item.description:
In this post, I will be developing two statistical learning models, namely Linear Regression and Polynomial Regression, and apply it to Thai student data from the Programme for International Student Assessment (PISA) 2018 data set to examine the impact of classroom competition and cooperation to students' academic performance.
(14 min read)

item.title: Classical Test Theory in R
item.dc:creator: Tarid Wongvorachan
item.description:
For this post, I will be analyzing characteristics of test items based on the framework of Classical Test Theory (CTT).
(13 min read)

item.title: Examining the Big 5 personality Dataset with factor analysis
item.dc:creator: Tarid Wongvorachan
item.description:
For this entry, I will be examining the Big 5 personality Inventory data set with Exploratory Data Analysis to identify potential structures of personality trait and verify them with Confirmatory Factor Analysis.
(8 min read)

item.title: Measuring Text Similarity with Movie plot data
item.dc:creator: Tarid Wongvorachan
item.description:
For this post, I will be analyzing textual data of movie plots to determine their similarity with TF-IDF and Clustering.
(7 min read)

item.title: Missing Data Analysis
item.dc:creator: Tarid Wongvorachan
item.description:
For this post, I will examine missing data in a large-scale dataset and discuss about numerous ways we can clean them as a part of data preparation.
(10 min read)

item.title: Applying Machine Learning to Audio Data: Visualization, Classification, and Recommendation
item.dc:creator: Tarid Wongvorachan
item.description:
For this entry, I am trying my hands on audio data to extract its features for exploratory data analysis (EDA), using machine learning algorithms to perform music classification, and finally build up on that result to develop a recommendation system for music of similar characteristics.
(13 min read)

item.title: Interactive plots for Suicide Data
item.dc:creator: Tarid Wongvorachan
item.description:
For this entry, will be visualizing suicide data from 1958 to 2015 with interactive plots to communicate insights to non-technical audience.
(14 min read)

item.title: Image Recognition with Artificial Neural Networks
item.dc:creator: Tarid Wongvorachan
item.description:
In this entry, we will be developing a deep learning algorithm - a sub-field of machine learning inspired by the structure of human brain (neural networks) - to classify images of single digit number (0-9).
(9 min read)

item.title: Anomaly Detection with New York City taxi data
item.dc:creator: Tarid Wongvorachan
item.description:
In this entry, I will be conducting anomaly detection to identify points of anomaly in the taxi passengers data in New York City from July 2014 to January 2015 at half-hourly intervals.
(4 min read)

item.title: Crime mapping in San Francisco with police data
item.dc:creator: Tarid Wongvorachan
item.description:
In this entry, we will explore San Francisco crime data from 2016 to 2018 to understand the relationship between civilian-reported incidents of crime and police-reported incidents of crime. Along the way we will use table intersection methods to subset our data, aggregation methods to calculate important statistics, and simple visualizations to understand crime trends.
(7 min read)

item.title: Exploring COVID-19 data from twitter with topic modeling
item.dc:creator: Tarid Wongvorachan
item.description:
This entry focuses on the exploration of twitter data from Alberta's Chief Medical Officer of Health via word cloud and topic modeling to gain insights in characteristics of public health messaging during the COVID-19 pandemic.
(7 min read)

item.title: Finding a home among the paradigm push-back with Dialectical Pluralism
item.dc:creator: Tarid Wongvorachan
item.description:
This entry discusses the reconciliation of quantitative and qualitative worldviews amidst the paradigm wars with pluralistic stance.
(2 min read)
